remarks: The Euclid-Euler theorem, or Perfect Number theorem.  A positive even integer ` N ` is a perfect number (that is, its divisor sum is ` 2 N ` ) if and only if it is of the form ` 2 ^ ( p - 1 ) x. ( 2 ^ p - 1 ) ` , where ` 2 ^ p - 1 ` is prime (a Mersenne prime).  (It follows from this that ` p ` is also prime.)  This is Metamath 100 proof #70. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 17-May-2016.)
